app.debug.description: Produces more informative errors when something goes wrong, but may expose sensitive data.
app.debug.name: Debug Mode

app.lock_settings.description: If true, disables editing for all settings
app.lock_settings.name: Lock Settings

app.enable_notifications.description: Enable browser notifications for research events
app.enable_notifications.name: Enable Notifications

app.enable_file_logging.description: Enable logging to files (WARNING: Log files are unencrypted and may contain sensitive data)
app.enable_file_logging.name: Enable File Logging

app.timezone.description: Timezone for date calculations (e.g., news subscription YYYY-MM-DD placeholder). Use 'UTC' for server time or specify your local timezone.
app.timezone.name: Timezone

app.max_concurrent_researches.description: Maximum number of concurrent research processes allowed per user
app.max_concurrent_researches.name: Max Concurrent Researches

app.queue_mode.description: Queue processing mode: 'direct' for immediate execution, 'queue' for background processing
app.queue_mode.name: Queue Mode

app.host.description: Host address to bind the web server
app.host.name: Web Host

app.external_url.description: Public URL where this application is accessible (e.g., http://localhost:5000, https://myapp.example.com). Used for generating links in notifications. Leave empty to auto-detect from request context.
app.external_url.name: External URL

app.theme.description: User interface color theme. Choose from 20 themes including popular developer themes.
app.theme.name: UI Theme

app.allow_registrations.description: Allow new user registrations through the web interface.
app.allow_registrations.name: Allow Registrations

llm.llamacpp_f16_kv.description: Use 16-bit floating point for LlamaCpp's key-value cache. Reduces memory usage compared to 32-bit; disable only if you need higher precision and have enough VRAM.
llm.llamacpp_f16_kv.name: Llamacpp F16 Kv

llm.llamacpp_model_path.description: Absolute file path to the GGUF model file for LlamaCpp. Required when using local model loading mode (llm.llamacpp_connection_mode='local').
llm.llamacpp_model_path.name: Llamacpp Model Path

llm.llamacpp_n_batch.description: Batch size for LlamaCpp token processing. Higher values improve inference speed but increase memory usage. Reduce if experiencing out-of-memory errors.
llm.llamacpp_n_batch.name: Llamacpp N Batch

llm.llamacpp_n_gpu_layers.description: Number of model layers to offload to GPU for acceleration in LlamaCpp. 0 = CPU only, higher values = more GPU usage and faster inference. Set based on your available VRAM.
llm.llamacpp_n_gpu_layers.name: Llamacpp N Gpu Layers

llm.lmstudio.url.description: HTTP endpoint URL where LM Studio is running locally. Include the full path (e.g., http://localhost:1234/v1 for OpenAI-compatible API format).
llm.lmstudio.url.name: Lmstudio Url

llm.max_tokens.description: Maximum tokens in model responses. Automatically capped at 80% of the context window size to leave room for prompt tokens.
llm.max_tokens.name: Max Tokens

llm.context_window_unrestricted.description: Let cloud providers automatically handle context sizing (recommended). Uncheck to set a specific limit.
llm.context_window_unrestricted.name: Use Unrestricted Cloud Context Window

llm.context_window_size.description: Maximum context window size in tokens for cloud LLMs. Only used when unrestricted context is disabled.
llm.context_window_size.name: Cloud Provider Context Window Limit

llm.local_context_window_size.description: Context window size in tokens for local LLMs (Ollama, LlamaCpp). Smaller values prevent memory issues.
llm.local_context_window_size.name: Local Provider Context Window Size

llm.supports_max_tokens.description: Feature flag for max_tokens parameter. Disable if your LLM API returns errors when max_tokens is set. When disabled, the parameter is not passed to the API.
llm.supports_max_tokens.name: Supports 'Max Tokens'

llm.model.description: The language model to use. Available models depend on the selected provider (e.g., 'gpt-4o' for OpenAI, 'gemma:7b' for Ollama). You can type any model name supported by your provider.
llm.model.name: LLM Model

llm.openai_endpoint.url.description: URL of a custom OpenAI-compatible API endpoint. Use for services like OpenRouter, vLLM, Groq, Together, or self-hosted endpoints that implement the OpenAI API format.
llm.openai_endpoint.url.name: Openai Endpoint Url

llm.ollama.url.description: HTTP endpoint URL where Ollama is running. Used to connect to local or remote Ollama instances for model inference.
llm.ollama.url.name: Ollama Endpoint Url

llm.ollama.enable_thinking.description: Enable thinking/reasoning mode for models like deepseek-r1 and qwen2.5. When enabled (recommended), the model performs internal reasoning for more accurate answers, but the reasoning content is automatically separated and excluded from the final response. When disabled, the model gives faster but potentially less accurate direct answers without reasoning.
llm.ollama.enable_thinking.name: Ollama Enable Thinking

llm.provider.description: The LLM service provider. Choose local providers (Ollama, LM Studio, LlamaCpp, vLLM) for free on-device inference, or cloud APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, OpenRouter) for hosted models.
llm.provider.name: LLM Provider

llm.temperature.description: Controls randomness in model outputs. Lower values (0.0-0.3) produce deterministic, factual responses; higher values (0.7-1.0) produce more creative and varied outputs.
llm.temperature.name: Temperature

llm.anthropic.api_key.description: Your Anthropic API key for Claude models. Get one at console.anthropic.com. Required when using the Anthropic provider.
llm.anthropic.api_key.name: Anthropic API Key

llm.openai.api_key.description: Your OpenAI API key for GPT models. Get one at platform.openai.com. Required when using the OpenAI provider.
llm.openai.api_key.name: OpenAI API Key

llm.openai_endpoint.api_key.description: API key for your custom OpenAI-compatible endpoint (OpenRouter, vLLM, Groq, etc.). Required if the endpoint requires authentication.
llm.openai_endpoint.api_key.name: OpenAI Endpoint API Key

report.enable_fact_checking.description: Enable fact checking for report contents
report.enable_fact_checking.name: Enable Fact Checking

report.searches_per_section.description: Number of searches to run per report section
report.searches_per_section.name: Searches Per Section

report.enable_file_backup.description: Also save reports to file system for external access (reports are always stored in database)
report.enable_file_backup.name: Enable File Backup

search.iterations.description: Maximum number of sequential search cycles to perform. Each iteration generates new follow-up questions based on previous results to progressively expand and refine the research.
search.iterations.name: Search Iterations

search.max_filtered_results.description: Maximum results to keep after LLM-based relevance filtering. Results above this limit are discarded to focus on the most relevant sources.
search.max_filtered_results.name: Max Filtered Results

search.max_results.description: Maximum raw search results to retrieve from the search engine per query, before any relevance filtering is applied.
search.max_results.name: Max Results

search.final_max_results.description: Maximum unique sources to include in the final research report after cross-engine deduplication and filtering.
search.final_max_results.name: Final Max Results

search.quality_check_urls.description: Validate that fetched webpage content matches the search result's title and snippet. Helps filter out broken links or mismatched content.
search.quality_check_urls.name: Quality Check Urls

search.questions_per_iteration.description: Number of search queries to generate and execute per iteration. More questions increase coverage but also increase API calls and processing time.
search.questions_per_iteration.name: Questions Per Iteration

focused_iteration.adaptive_questions.description: Enables intelligent adaptation of search queries based on previous results. 1=ON: If 3+ recent searches return 0 results, the LLM is warned that queries are 'too narrow'. 0=OFF: Stable main-branch behavior.
focused_iteration.adaptive_questions.name: Adaptive Question Generation

focused_iteration.knowledge_summary_limi.description: Controls how many previous search results the LLM sees when generating follow-up questions. Lower values (e.g., 10) reduce context size and focus the LLM on top results. Set to 0 for unlimited (LLM sees all results). NOTE: This only affects question generation - the final answer synthesis always sees ALL results.
focused_iteration.knowledge_summary_limi.name: Results Shown for Question Generation

focused_iteration.snippet_truncate.description: Maximum characters per snippet when showing search results to LLM for question generation. Shorter snippets (e.g., 200) reduce token usage and keep context focused. Set to 0 for full snippets. NOTE: This only affects question generation - the final answer synthesis sees full snippets.
focused_iteration.snippet_truncate.name: Snippet Length for Question Generation

focused_iteration.question_generator.description: Algorithm for generating follow-up search queries. 'browsecomp': Extracts entities (names, dates, locations) from the query and systematically combines them - more structured and predictable. 'flexible': Gives the LLM more freedom to explore different search strategies - less rigid but may be less consistent.
focused_iteration.question_generator.name: Question Generation Algorithm

focused_iteration.prompt_knowledge_trunc.description: Maximum characters of knowledge context to include in the LLM prompt when generating follow-up questions. This truncates the 'Current Knowledge Summary' section in the prompt. Set to 0 for unlimited. Lower values reduce token usage but may miss relevant context.
focused_iteration.prompt_knowledge_trunc.name: Prompt Knowledge Truncation

focused_iteration.previous_searches_limi.description: Maximum number of previous searches to show the LLM when generating follow-up questions. This helps the LLM avoid duplicate searches. Set to 0 for unlimited (show all previous searches). Higher values provide more context but use more tokens.
focused_iteration.previous_searches_limi.name: Previous Searches Shown

search.search_strategy.description: Research methodology. 'source-based': Finds and extracts from sources (good for comprehensive research). 'focused-iteration': Uses entity-based progressive exploration (optimized for factual Q&A, ~95% SimpleQA accuracy). 'iterative-refinement': LLM-guided progressive refinement with gap analysis.
search.search_strategy.name: Search Strategy

search.region.description: Geographic region for search results localization. Affects which results are prioritized based on regional relevance.
search.region.name: Search Region

search.safe_search.description: Filter out adult and inappropriate content from search results. Passed to search engines that support content filtering.
search.safe_search.name: Safe Search

search.search_language.description: Preferred language for search results. Search engines will attempt to return and prioritize results in this language when available.
search.search_language.name: Search Language

search.searches_per_section.description: Number of independent searches per report section when generating structured reports. Increases coverage but also increases API usage.
search.searches_per_section.name: Searches Per Section

search.skip_relevance_filter.description: Global override to skip LLM relevance filtering for ALL search engines. When false, filtering is auto-enabled for academic engines (arXiv, Semantic Scholar, etc.) that use keyword matching, and auto-disabled for generic engines (Google, Brave, etc.) that already use semantic search.
search.skip_relevance_filter.name: Skip Relevance Filter

search.journal_reputation.threshold.description: Minimum journal quality score (1-10 scale) required for academic results. Sources from journals below this threshold are excluded when the filter is enabled.
search.journal_reputation.threshold.name: Journal Quality Threshold

search.journal_reputation.max_context.description: Maximum characters of source content to include when the LLM evaluates journal quality. Larger values provide more context but use more tokens.
search.journal_reputation.max_context.name: Journal Quality Context Size

search.journal_reputation.exclude_non_pu.description: When enabled, excludes results without a formal journal publication reference. Use this to require only peer-reviewed academic sources.
search.journal_reputation.exclude_non_pu.name: Exclude Non-Published Results

search.journal_reputation.reanalysis_per.description: How often to refresh cached journal quality assessments. After this period, the LLM will re-evaluate the journal's reputation.
search.journal_reputation.reanalysis_per.name: Quality Reanalysis Period

search.snippets_only.description: Only retrieve search snippets instead of full webpage content. Reduces API usage and processing time, but provides less context for analysis.
search.snippets_only.name: Snippets Only

search.time_period.description: Time range filter for search results. Limits results to content published within the specified period (day, week, month, year, or all time).
search.time_period.name: Time Period

search.tool.description: Web search engine to use for research
search.tool.name: Search Engine

search.engine.web.arxiv.display_name.description: Display name to use in the U.I. for this search engine.
search.engine.web.arxiv.display_name.name: Display Name

search.engine.web.arxiv.description.description: Human-readable description of the search engine.
search.engine.web.arxiv.description.name: Description

search.engine.web.arxiv.class_name.description: Internal: Python class implementing the arXiv search engine.
search.engine.web.arxiv.class_name.name: Class Name

search.engine.web.arxiv.journal_reputati.description: Enable journal quality filtering for this search engine.
search.engine.web.arxiv.journal_reputati.name: Filter Low-Quality Journals

search.engine.web.arxiv.default_params.m.description: Maximum number of papers to retrieve from arXiv per search query.
search.engine.web.arxiv.default_params.m.name: Max Results

search.engine.web.arxiv.default_params.s.description: How to sort arXiv results: 'relevance' for best match, 'lastUpdatedDate' for recently updated, 'submittedDate' for newest submissions.
search.engine.web.arxiv.default_params.s.name: Sort By

search.engine.web.arxiv.default_params.s.description: Sort order for arXiv results: 'descending' (newest/most relevant first) or 'ascending' (oldest/least relevant first).
search.engine.web.arxiv.default_params.s.name: Sort Order

search.engine.web.arxiv.module_path.description: Internal: Python module path for the arXiv search engine implementation.
search.engine.web.arxiv.module_path.name: Module Path

search.engine.web.arxiv.reliability.description: Reliability rating (0-1) for arXiv as a source. Higher values indicate more trustworthy academic content.
search.engine.web.arxiv.reliability.name: Reliability

search.engine.web.arxiv.requires_api_key.description: Whether arXiv requires an API key. arXiv is free and open access, so this is false.
search.engine.web.arxiv.requires_api_key.name: Requires Api Key

search.engine.web.arxiv.strengths.description: Key advantages of arXiv: Free access to preprints, covers physics/math/CS/biology, fast publication of cutting-edge research.
search.engine.web.arxiv.strengths.name: Strengths

search.engine.web.arxiv.weaknesses.description: Limitations of arXiv: Preprints aren't peer-reviewed, limited to STEM fields, keyword-based search may miss semantic matches.
search.engine.web.arxiv.weaknesses.name: Weaknesses

search.engine.auto.display_name.description: Display name to use in the U.I. for this search engine.
search.engine.auto.display_name.name: Display Name

search.engine.auto.description.description: Human-readable description of the search engine.
search.engine.auto.description.name: Description
search.engine.auto.description.value: Attempt to choose the best combination of search engines automatically.

search.engine.auto.class_name.description: Internal: Python class implementing the automatic search engine selector.
search.engine.auto.class_name.name: Class Name

search.engine.auto.default_params.max_en.description: Maximum number of search engines to try before returning results. Auto mode selects the best engine(s) based on your query type.
search.engine.auto.default_params.max_en.name: Max Engines To Try

search.engine.auto.default_params.use_ap.description: Whether to include paid API services (Brave, SerpAPI, etc.) in auto-selection. Disable to only use free search engines.
search.engine.auto.default_params.use_ap.name: Use Api Key Services

search.engine.auto.module_path.description: Internal: Python module path for the auto search engine selector.
search.engine.auto.module_path.name: Module Path

search.engine.auto.reliability.description: Reliability rating for auto mode. Varies based on which underlying engine is selected.
search.engine.auto.reliability.name: Reliability

search.engine.auto.requires_api_key.description: Whether auto mode requires API keys. False because it can fall back to free engines like Wikipedia.
search.engine.auto.requires_api_key.name: Requires Api Key

search.engine.auto.requires_llm.description: Whether auto mode uses LLM to select the best engine. When disabled, falls back to rule-based selection.
search.engine.auto.requires_llm.name: Requires Llm

search.engine.auto.strengths.description: Key advantages of auto mode: Intelligently selects the best engine for each query type, tries multiple sources if needed.
search.engine.auto.strengths.name: Strengths

search.engine.auto.weaknesses.description: Limitations of auto mode: May use more API calls trying multiple engines, selection heuristics may not always be optimal.
search.engine.auto.weaknesses.name: Weaknesses
value: slightly slower due to LLM analysis

search.engine.web.brave.display_name.description: Display name to use in the U.I. for this search engine.
search.engine.web.brave.display_name.name: Display Name

search.engine.web.brave.description.description: Human-readable description of the search engine.
search.engine.web.brave.description.name: Description
search.engine.web.brave.description.value: Search the web using the Brave search engine.

search.engine.web.brave.api_key.description: The Brave API key to use.
search.engine.web.brave.api_key.name: Api Key

search.engine.web.brave.class_name.description: Internal: Python class implementing the Brave search engine.
search.engine.web.brave.class_name.name: Class Name

search.engine.web.brave.default_params.r.description: Geographic region code for Brave search results (e.g., 'US', 'UK', 'DE').
search.engine.web.brave.default_params.r.name: Region

search.engine.web.brave.default_params.s.description: Enable safe search filtering for Brave to exclude adult content.
search.engine.web.brave.default_params.s.name: Safe Search

search.engine.web.brave.default_params.s.description: Preferred language for Brave search results.
search.engine.web.brave.default_params.s.name: Search Language

search.engine.web.brave.default_params.t.description: Time range filter for Brave results (e.g., 'd' for day, 'w' for week, 'm' for month, 'y' for year).
search.engine.web.brave.default_params.t.name: Time Period

search.engine.web.brave.full_search_clas.description: Internal: Class for fetching full webpage content from Brave results.
search.engine.web.brave.full_search_clas.name: Full Search Class

search.engine.web.brave.full_search_modu.description: Internal: Module for fetching full webpage content from Brave results.
search.engine.web.brave.full_search_modu.name: Full Search Module

search.engine.web.brave.module_path.description: Internal: Python module path for the Brave search engine implementation.
search.engine.web.brave.module_path.name: Module Path

search.engine.web.brave.reliability.description: Reliability rating (0-1) for Brave Search. Good general-purpose search with privacy focus.
search.engine.web.brave.reliability.name: Reliability

search.engine.web.brave.requires_api_key.description: Whether Brave Search requires an API key. Yes - get one at brave.com/search/api.
search.engine.web.brave.requires_api_key.name: Requires Api Key

search.engine.web.brave.strengths.description: Key advantages of Brave: Privacy-focused, good semantic search, reasonable pricing, full-text retrieval available.
search.engine.web.brave.strengths.name: Strengths

search.engine.web.brave.supports_full_se.description: Whether Brave supports fetching full webpage content beyond snippets.
search.engine.web.brave.supports_full_se.name: Supports Full Search

search.engine.web.brave.weaknesses.description: Limitations of Brave: Smaller index than Google, requires paid API for production use.
search.engine.web.brave.weaknesses.name: Weaknesses
value: requires API key with usage limits

general.enable_fact_checking.description: Enable LLM-based fact verification for research findings. Adds additional validation pass to check claims against sources.
general.enable_fact_checking.name: Enable Fact Checking

general.knowledge_accumulation.description: How to accumulate knowledge across iterations: 'ITERATION' (carry forward per iteration), 'SECTION' (per section), 'FULL' (all content), 'NONE' (fresh each time).
general.knowledge_accumulation.name: Knowledge Accumulation

general.knowledge_accumulation_context_l.description: Maximum token count for accumulated knowledge context. Higher values preserve more history but increase LLM costs/latency.
general.knowledge_accumulation_context_l.name: Knowledge Accumulation Context Limit

general.output_dir.description: Directory where research report files are saved. Relative paths are relative to the application root.
general.output_dir.name: Output Dir

general.output_instructions.description: Customize how research outputs are formatted: language, tone, style, formatting preferences, audience level, etc. Examples: 'Respond in Spanish with formal tone' | 'Use simple language for beginners' | 'Be concise with bullet points'. Leave empty for default English output.
general.output_instructions.name: Output Instructions

search.engine.web.github.display_name.description: Display name to use in the U.I. for this search engine.
search.engine.web.github.display_name.name: Display Name

search.engine.web.github.description.description: Human-readable description of the search engine.
search.engine.web.github.description.name: Description

search.engine.web.github.class_name.description: Internal: Python class implementing the GitHub search engine.
search.engine.web.github.class_name.name: Class Name

search.engine.web.github.default_params..description: Include recent GitHub issues in repository search results.
search.engine.web.github.default_params..name: Include Issues

search.engine.web.github.default_params..description: Fetch and include README content when searching repositories.
search.engine.web.github.default_params..name: Include Readme

search.engine.web.github.default_params..description: Maximum number of GitHub results to retrieve per search.
search.engine.web.github.default_params..name: Max Results

search.engine.web.github.default_params..description: What to search on GitHub: 'repositories', 'code', 'issues', or 'users'.
search.engine.web.github.default_params..name: Search Type

search.engine.web.github.module_path.description: Internal: Python module path for the GitHub search engine implementation.
search.engine.web.github.module_path.name: Module Path

search.engine.web.github.reliability.description: Reliability rating (0-1) for GitHub as a source. Great for code and technical projects.
search.engine.web.github.reliability.name: Reliability

search.engine.web.github.requires_api_ke.description: Whether GitHub requires a personal access token. Optional but recommended for higher rate limits (1030 req/min).
search.engine.web.github.requires_api_ke.name: Requires Api Key

search.engine.web.github.api_key.description: GitHub Personal Access Token for API authentication. Without this, you're limited to 10 requests/minute for search API. With authentication, you get 30 requests/minute for search API.
search.engine.web.github.api_key.name: GitHub API Key

search.engine.web.github.strengths.description: Key advantages of GitHub: Excellent for code/technical queries, includes README content, issue discussions, works without API key.
search.engine.web.github.strengths.name: Strengths

search.engine.web.github.supports_full_s.description: Whether GitHub supports fetching full content (README, code files) beyond basic search results.
search.engine.web.github.supports_full_s.name: Supports Full Search

search.engine.web.github.weaknesses.description: Limitations of GitHub: Limited to code/technical content, strict rate limits without authentication.
search.engine.web.github.weaknesses.name: Weaknesses

search.engine.web.google_pse.display_nam.description: Display name to use in the U.I. for this search engine.
search.engine.web.google_pse.display_nam.name: Display Name

search.engine.web.google_pse.description.description: Human-readable description of the search engine.
search.engine.web.google_pse.description.name: Description
search.engine.web.google_pse.description.value: Search the web using Google's Programmable Search Engine API.

search.engine.web.google_pse.api_key.description: The Google PSE API key to use.
search.engine.web.google_pse.api_key.name: Api Key

search.engine.web.google_pse.class_name.description: Internal: Python class implementing this search engine. Do not modify unless extending functionality.
search.engine.web.google_pse.class_name.name: Class Name

search.engine.web.google_pse.default_par.description: Geographic region for search results (e.g., 'us', 'uk', 'de'). Results prioritized from this region.
search.engine.web.google_pse.default_par.name: Region

search.engine.web.google_pse.default_par.description: Enable Google SafeSearch to filter explicit content from results.
search.engine.web.google_pse.default_par.name: Safe Search

search.engine.web.google_pse.default_par.description: Language for search queries and results (e.g., 'English', 'German'). Filters results by language.
search.engine.web.google_pse.default_par.name: Search Language

search.engine.web.google_pse.full_search.description: Internal: Class used for full-text content retrieval after initial search. Do not modify.
search.engine.web.google_pse.full_search.name: Full Search Class

search.engine.web.google_pse.full_search.description: Internal: Python module path for full search functionality. Do not modify.
search.engine.web.google_pse.full_search.name: Full Search Module

search.engine.web.google_pse.module_path.description: Internal: Python module path for this search engine implementation. Do not modify.
search.engine.web.google_pse.module_path.name: Module Path

search.engine.web.google_pse.reliability.description: Reliability score (0-1) indicating result quality. Google PSE is highly reliable (0.9) due to Google's indexing quality.
search.engine.web.google_pse.reliability.name: Reliability

search.engine.web.google_pse.requires_ap.description: Indicates this engine requires a Google API key and Custom Search Engine ID. Get credentials from Google Cloud Console.
search.engine.web.google_pse.requires_ap.name: Requires Api Key

search.engine.web.google_pse.strengths.description: Advantages of Google PSE: Custom search scope, high-quality results, domain-specific filtering, configurable search experience.
search.engine.web.google_pse.strengths.name: Strengths

search.engine.web.google_pse.supports_fu.description: Indicates this engine can fetch full page content after initial search, not just snippets.
search.engine.web.google_pse.supports_fu.name: Supports Full Search

search.engine.web.google_pse.weaknesses.description: Limitations: Requires API key, limited to 10,000 queries/day on free tier, requires search engine configuration in Google Control Panel.
search.engine.web.google_pse.weaknesses.name: Weaknesses
value: requires API key with usage limits
limited to 10,000 queries/day on free tier
requires search engine configuration in Google Control Panel

search.engine.local.local_all.display_na.description: Display name to use in the U.I. for this search engine.
search.engine.local.local_all.display_na.name: Display Name

search.engine.local.local_all.descriptio.description: Human-readable description of the search engine.
search.engine.local.local_all.descriptio.name: Description
search.engine.local.local_all.descriptio.value: Search only local documents using RAG.

search.engine.DEFAULT_SEARCH_ENGINE.description: Fallback search engine used when the configured engine is unavailable or has errors.
search.engine.DEFAULT_SEARCH_ENGINE.name: Default Search Engine

search.engine.local.local_all.class_name.description: Internal: Python class implementing local document search. Do not modify.
search.engine.local.local_all.class_name.name: Class Name

search.engine.local.local_all.module_pat.description: Internal: Python module path for local search implementation. Do not modify.
search.engine.local.local_all.module_pat.name: Module Path

search.engine.local.local_all.reliabilit.description: Reliability score (0-1) for local search. Quality depends on your document collection and indexing.
search.engine.local.local_all.reliabilit.name: Reliability

search.engine.local.local_all.requires_a.description: Local document search does not require any external API keys.
search.engine.local.local_all.requires_a.name: Requires Api Key

search.engine.local.local_all.requires_l.description: Indicates this engine uses the LLM to rerank and filter results for relevance.
search.engine.local.local_all.requires_l.name: Requires Llm

search.engine.local.local_all.strengths.description: Advantages: Searches all local document collections at once, works offline, uses your private documents.
search.engine.local.local_all.strengths.name: Strengths

search.engine.local.local_all.weaknesses.description: Limitations: May return too many results from mixed collections, requires documents to be indexed first.
search.engine.local.local_all.weaknesses.name: Weaknesses

search.engine.web.tavily.requires_api_ke.name: Requires Api Key

search.engine.web.tavily.reliability.description: Reliability score (0-1). Tavily rated high (0.8) - AI-optimized search designed for research applications.
search.engine.web.tavily.reliability.name: Reliability

search.engine.web.tavily.strengths.description: Advantages: AI-powered search optimization, built-in answer extraction, research-focused results, fast responses.
search.engine.web.tavily.strengths.name: Strengths

search.engine.web.tavily.supports_full_s.description: Indicates this engine can fetch full page content after initial search, not just snippets.
search.engine.web.tavily.supports_full_s.name: Supports Full Search

search.engine.web.tavily.weaknesses.description: Limitations: Requires paid API key with usage limits, newer service with less historical data coverage.
search.engine.web.tavily.weaknesses.name: Weaknesses
value: requires API key with usage limits
newer service with smaller historical data

search.engine.web.tavily.use_in_auto_sea.description: Include Tavily in auto search mode
search.engine.web.tavily.use_in_auto_sea.name: Include in Auto Search

search.engine.local.local_all.use_in_aut.description: Include local documents in auto search mode
search.engine.local.local_all.use_in_aut.name: Include in Auto Search

search.engine.local.personal_notes.use_i.description: Include personal notes in auto search mode
search.engine.local.personal_notes.use_i.name: Include in Auto Search

search.engine.local.project_docs.use_in_.description: Include project documents in auto search mode
search.engine.local.project_docs.use_in_.name: Include in Auto Search

search.engine.local.research_papers.use_.description: Include research papers in auto search mode
search.engine.local.research_papers.use_.name: Include in Auto Search

llm.llamacpp_connection_mode.description: Connection mode for LlamaCpp: 'local' for direct model loading or 'http' for using a remote server
llm.llamacpp_connection_mode.name: LlamaCpp Connection Mode

llm.llamacpp_server_url.description: URL of the LlamaCpp HTTP server (only used when connection mode is 'http')
llm.llamacpp_server_url.name: LlamaCpp Server URL

app.warnings.dismiss_high_context.description: Dismiss warnings about high context window sizes that may cause memory issues
app.warnings.dismiss_high_context.name: Dismiss High Context Warnings

app.warnings.dismiss_low_context_focused.description: Dismiss warnings about using focused iteration with low context window sizes
app.warnings.dismiss_low_context_focused.name: Dismiss Low Context + Focused Strategy Warnings

app.warnings.dismiss_model_mismatch.description: Dismiss warnings about context size vs model size mismatches
app.warnings.dismiss_model_mismatch.name: Dismiss Model Mismatch Warnings

app.warnings.dismiss_searxng_recommendat.description: Dismiss recommendations about using more questions instead of iterations with SearXNG
app.warnings.dismiss_searxng_recommendat.name: Dismiss SearXNG Optimization Tips

rate_limiting.enabled.description: Enable adaptive rate limiting system that learns optimal wait times for each search engine
rate_limiting.enabled.name: Enable Rate Limiting

rate_limiting.exploration_rate.description: Percentage of attempts that will explore faster rates to discover improvements (0.0-1.0)
rate_limiting.exploration_rate.name: Exploration Rate

rate_limiting.learning_rate.description: How quickly to adapt to new rate limit information (higher = faster adaptation)
rate_limiting.learning_rate.name: Learning Rate

rate_limiting.memory_window.description: Number of recent attempts to keep in memory for learning
rate_limiting.memory_window.name: Memory Window

rate_limiting.decay_per_day.description: Confidence decay factor per day for old rate limit estimates (0.5-0.99, lower = faster decay)
rate_limiting.decay_per_day.name: Decay Factor Per Day

rate_limiting.llm_enabled.description: Enable adaptive rate limiting for LLM API calls (e.g., for free tier APIs with request limits)
rate_limiting.llm_enabled.name: Enable LLM Rate Limiting

benchmark.evaluation.endpoint_url.description: Endpoint URL for evaluation model (when using OpenAI-compatible APIs)
benchmark.evaluation.endpoint_url.name: Evaluation Endpoint URL

benchmark.evaluation.temperature.description: Temperature for evaluation (0 recommended for consistency)
benchmark.evaluation.temperature.name: Evaluation Temperature

news.feed.default_limit.description: Default number of news items to show in feed
news.feed.default_limit.name: Default Feed Limit

news.storage.default_limit.description: Default limit for storing news items
news.storage.default_limit.name: Default Storage Limit

news.preferences.max_stored.description: Maximum number of stored preferences per user
news.preferences.max_stored.name: Max Stored Preferences

news.subscription.refresh_minutes.description: Default subscription refresh interval in minutes
news.subscription.refresh_minutes.name: Subscription Refresh Minutes

news.trending.lookback_hours.description: Hours to look back for trending analysis
news.trending.lookback_hours.name: Trending Lookback Hours

news.display.max_query_length.description: Maximum query display length in UI
news.display.max_query_length.name: Max Query Display Length

news.scheduler.enabled.description: Enable automatic news subscription updates for active users
news.scheduler.enabled.name: Enable News Scheduler

news.scheduler.retention_hours.description: Hours to keep user credentials in memory after last activity
news.scheduler.retention_hours.name: User Retention Period (hours)

news.scheduler.cleanup_interval_hours.description: How often to run cleanup job for inactive users
news.scheduler.cleanup_interval_hours.name: Cleanup Interval (hours)

news.scheduler.max_jitter_seconds.description: Maximum random delay added to subscription checks to spread load
news.scheduler.max_jitter_seconds.name: Maximum Jitter (seconds)

news.scheduler.max_concurrent_jobs.description: Maximum concurrent subscription checks across all users
news.scheduler.max_concurrent_jobs.name: Max Concurrent Jobs

news.scheduler.batch_size.description: Number of subscriptions to process in each batch
news.scheduler.batch_size.name: Subscription Batch Size

news.scheduler.activity_check_interval.description: How often to check for due subscriptions (minutes)
news.scheduler.activity_check_interval.name: Activity Check Interval (minutes)

search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..description: Include publication type (e.g., Clinical Trial, Meta-Analysis) in context for analysis
search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..name: Include Publication Type in Context

search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..description: Include journal name in context for analysis
search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..name: Include Journal in Context

search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..description: Include publication year in context for analysis
search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..name: Include Year in Context

search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..description: Include author names in context for analysis
search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..name: Include Authors in Context

search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..description: Include full publication date in context for analysis
search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..name: Include Full Date in Context

search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..description: Include MeSH terms (medical subject headings) in context for analysis
search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..name: Include MeSH Terms in Context

search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..description: Include article keywords in context for analysis
search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..name: Include Keywords in Context

search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..description: Include DOI (Digital Object Identifier) in context for analysis
search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..name: Include DOI in Context

search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..description: Include PubMed ID in context for analysis
search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..name: Include PMID in Context

search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..description: Include PMC free full text availability in context for analysis
search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..name: Include PMC Availability in Context

search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..description: Include volume, issue, and pages in context for analysis
search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..name: Include Citation Details in Context

search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..description: Include language indicator in context for analysis
search.engine.web.pubmed.default_params..name: Include Language in Context

research_library.storage_path.description: Base path for storing research library documents. Each user will have their own subdirectory unless shared library is enabled.
research_library.storage_path.name: Library Storage Path

research_library.shared_library.description: ⚠️ WARNING: When enabled, all users share the same library directory. Documents from all users will be visible to each other. Only enable in trusted environments.
research_library.shared_library.name: Shared Library Mode

research_library.enable_pdf_storage.description: ⚠️ PRIVACY WARNING: PDFs will be stored unencrypted on disk, exposing your research interests to anyone with filesystem access. Only enable if you need PDF files for external tools.
research_library.enable_pdf_storage.name: Enable PDF Storage

research_library.enable_txt_storage.description: ⚠️ PRIVACY WARNING: Text files will be stored unencrypted on disk for RAG/ChromaDB integration. This exposes document contents to anyone with filesystem access.
research_library.enable_txt_storage.name: Enable Text File Storage

research_library.auto_index_enabled.description: Automatically index documents for RAG search when they are added to collections (via upload or download). Indexing happens in the background without blocking uploads.
research_library.auto_index_enabled.name: Auto-Index New Documents

notifications.service_url.description: Notification service URL(s). Supports multiple comma-separated URLs to send notifications to multiple destinations (e.g., discord://webhook_id/token, mailto://user:pass@smtp.gmail.com?to=recipient@example.com). See documentation for supported services.
notifications.service_url.name: Service URL(s)

notifications.rate_limit_per_hour.description: Maximum number of notifications per hour (prevents spam)
notifications.rate_limit_per_hour.name: Rate Limit (Hourly)

notifications.rate_limit_per_day.description: Maximum number of notifications per day (prevents spam)
notifications.rate_limit_per_day.name: Rate Limit (Daily)

notifications.on_subscription_update.description: Send notification when subscriptions have new content
notifications.on_subscription_update.name: Subscription Updates

notifications.on_subscription_error.description: Send notification when subscription encounters an error
notifications.on_subscription_error.name: Subscription Errors

notifications.on_research_queued.description: Send notification when research is added to queue
notifications.on_research_queued.name: Research Queued

notifications.on_api_quota_warning.description: Send notification when API quota/rate limits are exceeded
notifications.on_api_quota_warning.name: API Quota Warnings

notifications.on_auth_issue.description: Send notification when authentication fails for API services
notifications.on_auth_issue.name: Authentication Issues
